subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|s=戆}}
“Stupid”. Attested abundantly in Old Chinese, but obsolete in modern varieties. Compared with Proto-Mon *''trɔɔʔ'' (> {{cog|mnw|သ္ဒိုဟ်||tr=tɜ̀h|foolish, stupid}}) by {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|s=戆|alt=怣-Min Nan,憨-Min Nan}}
Dialectally preserved word for “stupid”, attested since Middle Chinese. Relationship to Etymology 1 is unknown.

Compare Proto-Central Chin *''ŋoŋ'' (“dull, stupid”) > {{cog|lus|ngawng||dull, stupid}}, Proto-Tai-Kadai *''ŋV:ŋ.T'' (“stupid”) > {{cog|za|nguengh||stupid}}, as well as {{cog|mkh-okm|lṅaṅya||stupid, obtuse, ignorant}} > {{cog|km|ល្ងង់}}).

{{zh-ref|Bauer (1996)}} suggests that this root may have entered Old Southern Chinese during the period of its early contact with Tai-speaking peoples in southern China.
